reviews.text: We spent five nights in hotels I picked from Tripadvisor, which seldom has let me down. The Residence Inn in Durango was the best of a very good lot. We had a friendly reception with a hospitality hour drink and snack when we arrived. We had a two beddroom suite for my wife and me and four teenagers. It had pleanty of room for us. The indoor pool and spa looked wonderful, but being in a winter location we did not bring suits. The wireless internet worked well and was free. The breakfast was ample, with something for everyone. The staff were very good. The only drawback was that it was a few blocks across a busy highway to the train station, but it had much nicer accommodations than the downtown properties.
reviews.title: Impeccable!

reviews.text: I stayed for a week with my kids while in town for a spring break ski trip. The room was nice, updated and clean with flat panel tv's in the living and bed rooms. The room was quiet and we happen to have a nice view of the mountain across the highway. Looks like the only rooms that would have any view would be the 3rd floor, highway facing rooms. The hot breakfast buffet was very good and many more choices than your typical continental breakfast. My only disappointment was the kitchen (which was one of the main reasons I selected this place). We had planned to cook a few meals in to save on some expenses. The utensils, pots and pan selection were limited and very poor quality. So poor that after one use, I didn't try to use them again. And the front desk told me that was all they had. So if you are not planning on cooking, then everything else was very nice.
reviews.title: Everything was very good, but don't plan on doing much with the 'kitchen'.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on vacation with my husband during a ski trip. Nice, newer hotel with friendly staff, clean and quiet rooms, and nice ambiance overall. Good price for a resort area. I often stay at Residence Inns on business trips because of the perks they offer such as free breakfast, free internet, kitchen, and spacious rooms. This one did not disappoint. Only drawback was that housekeeping was a bit sloppy and did not vacuum our room or take away the trash. Very close to downtown Durango and restaurants and sights. About 30 minutes to the Durango ski area. I would recommend this place to friends.
reviews.title: Quiet, Clean, Friendly, and Overall Good

likes.liked: — Newer hotel and prompt check in, free internet and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a king suite, and it was terrific. Very roomy. Very clean. Not much of a view, but who cared. Nice furnishings. Comfortable bed. Large bathroom area with outside vanity/sink. Huge closet. Well stocked kitchen. Great plasma TV.
reviews.title: Terrific Residence Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast bar was wonderful. Hot items: oatmeal, eggs, sausage, potatoes, biscuits, gravy...cold cereal and breads, too.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to relax after a long day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our Southwest road-trip, this was by far the best accommodation we experienced. As usual, Marriott did not disappoint us. The room was clean, had a full kitchen, and the most comfortable bed and pillows!
reviews.title: Excellent Place to Stay!

likes.disliked: — That we couldn't stay there longer - ha!

reviews.text: This hotel is on a main road/highway just as you enter Durango from the West. However, it is an easy walk to the town center and very close and within walking distance (maybe 5 minute walk) to the Durango-Silverton Train Station.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: The Durango-Silverton Narrow Gauge Train is an event not to be missed. This was our primary purpose in visiting Durango and we thoroughly enjoyed our day on the train to/from Silverton.
reviews.title: Nice place, meets our skiing needs

likes.liked: — Condo type lodging (in-room kitchen) with big chain hotel predictability

reviews.text: Durango is a great place and The Residence Inn made it an even better stay for us. Just about everything was right - staff, room, pool, breakfast were all well above average. One minor thing, the room was a little small for a family of four but we knew that before we went so it's not really a complaint, just advice for others. As for Durango and the area - we only had three days but the town is lovely with lots of choice for good food, Mesa Verde is essential and the Durango - Silverton Railroad is brilliant for the whole family.
reviews.title: The Residence Inn is a nice place

reviews.text: We are staying here for a ski trip and this hotel meets our needs very well. We enjoy having the ability to have a kitchen and cook in our rooms. Each unit has seperate heat & AC controls. At night, we run a humidifer and leave the HVAC fan switch set to "on" to maks any (typical) hotel hallway noises.
reviews.title: Overrated

likes.liked: — Uncomfortable bed, loud air conditioner, strange sound from the fridge

reviews.text: Our stay here could not have been better....except maybe for a friendlier female desk clerk! The accomodations were outstanding and perfect for our family. We had the 2 room suite and we are sold on Residence Inn in every way! Great breakfasts and evening snacks, nice pool and hot tub, immaculate and quiet rooms, free internet, 3 large flat screen TV's, and perfect location to downtown Durango and the Animas river. We were originally booked for 4 nights, but didn't want to leave, so were able to extend an extra night. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel. The suite rooms are so roomy with a kitchen and living room which was great. The free breakfast was very good with a hot waffle maker and there was a manager's reception the night before. The bed was so comfortable. Front desk very accommodating. The hotel is very close to center of town (via car) with many places to eat. Durango was a cute place to visit for one night.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel so much that I wish we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: It is Nice to Have a Separate Bedroom

reviews.text: This older property is located on the road to Mesa Verde and a short drive from downtown. It is well maintained and the staff is helpful.
reviews.title: Travel agent views on the Durango Residence Inn

reviews.text: We enjoyed having a kitchen and separate bedroom. Breakfast was good.
reviews.title: NOT UP TO PAR with Residence Inn standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed this hotel. The King sized bed was great, the breakfast and the happy hour was very welcome. The people were very nice, and the location was unbeatable. We in fact did walk to the downtown area, including the train to Silverton. And I'm an middle aged woman, so if I could walk it, anyone could. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great place, moderate cost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is not bad at all, stayed for our train trip to Silverton and back and found it very convenient. Clean and nice pool.
reviews.title: Very convenient

likes.disliked: — restricted parking in the back - soon gets full

reviews.text: Stayed at the Residence Inn for one night on our way from Alamosa (Great Sand Dunes Nat. Park) to Moab.
reviews.title: Good for an overnight stay

likes.disliked: — Room was not ready at checkin

reviews.text: We had - as usual - a 2-bedroom-suite. And - that's why we like the Residence Inns - the suite was perfect for our family of four (2 teens). Clean and comfortable and a lot of space.
reviews.title: Typical residence inn

likes.disliked: — needed to enter master to use bathroom

reviews.text: Breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Excellent Residence Inn
